hook.text: People said AI would replace factory workers first. Instead, it came for artists and writers.

buildup.text: Generative AI can write articles, create images, compose music, and draft marketing copy.

discovery.text: Creative work that seemed uniquely human turns out to rely heavily on patterns AI can learn.

twist.text: But AI creates average content fluently. Truly original, culturally resonant work still requires humans.

climax.text: Creative professionals who use AI as a tool produce more, not less. Resistance often means falling behind.

punchline.text: AI didn't replace the artist. It replaced the artist who refused to evolve.

quiz.question: Why were creative jobs unexpectedly affected by AI?
options: Creative work relies on patterns that AI can learn to reproduce
AI was specifically designed to target artists
Creative jobs have always been easy to automate
